project.description: Security-focused HTTP utilities library providing validation pipelines for detecting attack patterns (path traversal, injection, protocol violations), SSL/TLS context management, and HTTP client handlers for secure web communication.

cui-http.responsibility: Provides security-focused HTTP utilities including validation pipelines for detecting attack patterns (path traversal, injection, XSS), async-first HTTP client adapters with ETag caching and retry resilience, and SSL/TLS context management for secure web communication.
cui-http.responsibility_reasoning: From README.adoc 'What is it?' section and package-info.java files for security, client, and adapter packages
cui-http.purpose_reasoning: packaging=jar, provides reusable HTTP utilities, no main class or runtime entry point

de.cuioss.http.security.pipeline.description: Validation pipelines combining multiple stages for URL paths, parameters, and headers. Includes URLPathValidationPipeline, URLParameterValidationPipeline, HTTPHeaderValidationPipeline, and PipelineFactory for creating configured validators.

de.cuioss.http.client.adapter.description: Async-first HTTP adapter API with composable decorators. ETagAwareHttpAdapter provides caching, ResilientHttpAdapter adds retry with exponential backoff. All methods return CompletableFuture with HttpResult for type-safe error handling.

de.cuioss.http.security.validation.description: Individual validation stages for HTTP security checking including LengthValidationStage, CharacterValidationStage, DecodingStage, NormalizationStage, and PatternMatchingStage. Immutable, thread-safe, and composable.

de.cuioss.http.client.handler.description: HTTP client utilities with HttpHandler builder, SecureSSLContextProvider for TLS 1.2+ contexts, and HttpStatusFamily for RFC 7231 status classification. Provides secure defaults for HTTPS operations.

cui-http.key_dependencies_reasoning: cui-java-tools provides core CUI utilities and CuiLogger; jspecify defines null-safety contract used throughout the module
cui-http.skills_by_profile_reasoning: Removed java-cdi (no CDI annotations), removed integration-testing and benchmark-testing profiles (no *IT.java or *Benchmark.java files). Added cui-http and cui-testing-http based on MockWebServer test dependency.
